#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Market an Invention
#Text=Create a comprehensive , cost-effective marketing plan for your new invention to let customers know who you are and what your invention has to offer .
#Text=The inventor should know the marketplace , have the ability to demonstrate the invention and explain the value of the product .
#Text=It 's not difficult to market an invention , but it 's a process that takes time .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Plan to market an invention .
#Text=Define your customers .
#Text=It 's important to know who your target audience is .
#Text=If you have invented a new toy , your best customers will be children .
#Text=But , you still have to appeal to the parents who have the expendable income needed to buy your product .
#Text=Establish a fair market price .
#Text=Consider all the costs to produce the invention .
#Text=This can include labor and the raw materials .
#Text=Keep in mind that the cost of manufacturing your invention will fluctuate based on the increase or decrease of materials and labor .
#Text=Check out your competition .
#Text=Get an idea or ballpark figure of what the market can handle .
#Text=Evaluate your findings .
#Text=Not only do you need to determine how much profit you can make for each sale , you also need to consider the price consumers are willing to pay for such an item .
#Text=Market your invention using every possible method available .
#Text=Take your invention on the road .
#Text=Attend as many trade shows or conventions as possible .

#Text=Demonstrate your invention or put it in the hands of investors and distributors at national invention trade shows like the National Congress of Inventor Organizations , INPEX , AOTA or Innovative Products Technologies , Inc.
#Text=Contact local newspapers .
#Text=Ask newspaper editors to publish your press release profiling your new invention .
#Text=Keep the editor current with successes .
#Text=Consult with companies or businesses that carry similar products .
#Text=They may be interested in promoting or putting your invention on their shelves .
#Text=Advertise your invention on blogs and nationally recognized websites , such as IPWatchdog.com .
#Text=Some bloggers will write reviews for your invention if you allow them to test it .
#Text=Promote your invention using magazines like Inventors Digest .
#Text=You can also market an invention in magazines that cater to your target audience .
#Text=Develop your own website to promote your invention or use a host company to build and host your website .
#Text=Use this website as an online brochure .
#Text=Highlight what problem or need your invention fulfills .
#Text=Include information detailing the benefits of your invention .
#Text=You may want to include a video demonstration that shows consumers how to use your product .
#Text=Display good-quality pictures and graphics on your website .
#Text=Make sure they are professional yet eye-catching .
#Text=People will judge your invention on the quality of your website .
#Text=Promote your invention through social network sites like Facebook and Twitter .
#Text=Post press releases , offer discounts for new customers and come up with other marketing strategies for your invention that have the potential to go viral .
#Text=Connect with investors on the Internet .
#Text=Post your invention , a brief description and all contact information that you would like posted with your idea on invention websites .
#Text=Contact local radio stations .
#Text=Get on the air as a guest speaker or inquire about advertising through their stations .
#Text=Attend your Chamber of Commerce meetings and local seminars and network with businesses that may be interested in your invention .
#Text=Think about working with a marketing firm to help you with the licensing and advertising of your invention .
#Text=Do extensive research before choosing a marketing firm .
#Text=If you are introducing a completely new idea , you may need to conduct more market research before you begin advertising your product than a person who has an invention for a booming field .
#Text=Be patient , stay focused and do n't get frustrated .
#Text=It can take a year or longer before you see your invention on store shelves .
#Text=Video
#Text=Tips
#Text=Learn by talking to individuals .
#Text=See how the consumer is currently using similar products .
#Text=Be sure to test and check over your invention to ensure that it 's flawless before showing it to potential clients , licensees and investors .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Never market your invention before you apply and receive a patent .
#Text=Someone could make a similar design and get the patent first , which would make it illegal for you to sell the product without violating the other person 's patent .
#Text=Beware of scams .
#Text=Many companies offer to help you get your invention off the ground with potential buyers for a fee .
#Text=The majority of these companies will take your money , leaving you with a useless design patent and providing no sales leads .
